enrichment.summary: This executive order amends a previous order to expand the President's Council of Advisors on Science and Technology by increasing its membership limit to 32 individuals. It clarifies that nothing in the order affects the authority of executive agencies or the Office of Management and Budget.
potential_concerns: Expanding PCAST membership to 32 may dilute the influence of existing scientific-researchers and technology-workers by increasing diversity but complicating consensus.
Without clear criteria for member selection, the order could lead to underrepresentation of emerging scientific fields or minority technology disciplines.
The increased council size may strain administrative resources and reduce meeting efficiency, indirectly limiting timely scientific advice impacting technology-workers.
Lack of changes to agency authority may generate confusion among scientific-researchers on how PCAST recommendations align with agency actions.
